Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cauliflower appetizer

gTwX2cpUIh67mmbJCteiFA.text: The male barista needs a SERIOUS attitude check. Good food tho. I like the falafel salad with avocado added. Also the mograbieh is super good did I spell that right? But my all time favorite is the moussaka with saffron rice (bring that back!!!) unfortunately it's been off the menu for awhile. Anyways good place great food rude barista man.

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blueberry sourdough buckwheat pancakes
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Falafel Salad with avocado
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Moussaka and Falafel Salad

UA3NkWwChBIPo-qs-L-fng.text: Some of the best vegan food that I have ever had. And they have kombucha!  First, let me start off by saying that the atmosphere of this place is really laid back - you sit pretty close to the tables next to you but it isn't too shabby.   Our server was awesome. We went here on a Saturday night and had a crazy wait time for our food - it would have been easy to give this place a lower rating - but the way that our server handled the situation was amazing.   I will definitely go back here, and recommend this place to anyone looking to have some great vegan food!

yIjtVvhoaf_47px9S3qJLQ.text: I lucked in for a spot at the bar on a busy Saturday morning and was further rewarded with the sourdough buckwheat pancakes.  They were remarkably thick and tender, with a pleasant grassy (the fermented grains?) and subtle tang.  The plentiful blueberries, swirling butter, and maple syrup brought a familiar comfort to these wonderfully unique pancakes.

UXqtdescsVGq8130ZLQuEw.text: A small vegan cafe in the hidden parts of town. This place rocks! I mean on walking in it's super cozy and welcoming. The staff are so friendly with a greeting on entering. They have a specials board and the baked goods and coffee bar set up at first glance. The waitress talked about a few things on the menu as it was a first time trip there. Me and my girlfriend ordered a bit of everything and shared it. I'm happy we did because the portions are HUGE! The tofu scramble is amazing along with the spicy meatless sausage, the kale was packed with flavor and all had a great amount of spicy to it. The pancakes where next level and I'm not even a pancake person. The blueberrys really added a extra "bam spice it up a notch" the potato's where just as excellent as everything else with a wonderful crisp. But to be honest my favorite part of the whole meal was the chocolate chip cookies and the spicy chocolate with a glass of almond milk. I ordered another cookie because I could not get over how soft and flavorful they where. I'm honestly hooked. I can't wait till next time I'm in this part of town so I can stop by again because this time I'm also gonna get some cookies to go! This is a must try for someone looking for something different or just a healthy full hearted vegan breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cookies and spicy chocolate with almond milk
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pancake
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kofta Tofu Scramble, latkes

NgjD-DH93FbGLNSkAMtzYA.text: Vegan or not, B52 is a must try! I dragged my steak-loving friend here for lunch and he was surprisingly in love with the food.  It was my first visit and needless to say, I think I'm already obsessed. Definitely one of the best vegan restaurants I've been to in Pittsburgh.  I stopped in during the lunch rush. With the small space and limited seating, we would have had a bit of wait, but luckily, there were open spots at the bar. Service was fantastic from start to finish. We were promptly greeted by our waitress who was friendly and helpful throughout the meal - amazing all around!  The menu takes middle eastern cuisine and gives it a unique flare. Some items and combos may sound a bit odd, but they surprisingly work. I ordered the koftka tofu scramble which came with wilted kale, eggs, and a seitan/tofu mix. Highly recommend! Not only was it delicious but the portion was huge so you're sure to be satisfied afterwards. The seitan/tofu had the consistency of ground beef and was seasoned very well but not too overpowering. To satisfy my sweet tooth, I had the almond cashew yogurt which was essentially a yogurt parfait. Simple but still delicious.  Although vegan food has a bad reputation, B52 definitely raises the bar. This is a great lunch or dinner option for vegans and even non-vegans. If I could come here for every meal, I would be the happiest veghead on the planet.

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Koftka Tofu Scramble. So good!
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Almond Cashew Yogurt

HwAHkuiLEEoMG_07F7_KLQ.text: This is the best vegan restaurant in Pittsburgh. I don't even know where to start. First, every menu item is amazing. I'm currently sitting at the bar eating a seitan salad and trying not to INHALE it omg. I haven't tried something I don't like here. Second, their cookies are bomb.com . They bring a new joy to my existence. I take them to work and everyone loves them. Staff are friendly. The owner came to chat with me one day. I really wanted to tell him his restaurant gets a big chunk of my paycheck , but I decided to act like a normal person that day and simply compliment his amazing restaurant. I bring people here often. Love love love it. Thanks for consistency in service and being in an area that I don't have to pay for parking. Much appreciated.

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

txhojyOE0DEwNvq6onv35w.text: This place is probably good as a restaurant, but not the best coffee shop type atmosphere if you're looking to hang out and drink coffee or get some work done. The music is really loud and they want to seat you rather than just letting folks set up at a table.   That being said, I got their vanilla flavored latte special and it was delicious...almost $6...but delicious.   I will give this place another chance for a meal, but will probably go elsewhere when I want t hang out at a coffee shop.

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vanilla Latte

fo_78d3XOus5QOoOjFV_FA.text: The servers seem too hip to care for good service. Went for an evening for dinner. One of their dinner plates was not available, even though it was past 6pm, with no offer to compensate.

eKksozfUgkM8-HlJXzJeKA.text: I've been here for both dinner and brunch and it's great.  The food is all wonderful and the service is friendly.  The space is tiny, but it's worth the wait.  Just give them your number and wander the adorable neighborhood.

p5R9ZY6ab53zNSWvF99FbA.text: Loved the wonderful vegan brunch! The falafel wrap, lentil soup and the cashew cheese flat bread were perfectly sumptuous. The service was excellent. Definitely plan to make this a regular stop on weekends!

rTxEE0y3rnkjGwg93A14sQ.text: B52 recently opened in Pittsburgh and as a vegetarian, I had lots of friends sending me articles about the new vegan place opening in Lawrenceville. I couldn't be happier that my friends shared the news with me. B52 is a lovely, sun-filled cafe on Butler street (at the corner of Butler and 52nd... hence B52, I would presume). They have a coffee bar and lots of pastries and tables for sitting and ordering food. Their website touts the food as an American and Middle Eastern fusion, and it is quite delightful. As a vegetarian, I often am disappointed with vegan places because I still do want the eggs, cheese, dairy, etc. and miss them in vegan cuisine. However, the food at B52 is great and I didn't even notice the lack of dairy and eggs! The first time I went, I had the Kofta Tofu Scramble, which was good. Both times I went, I had a wonderful drink called the Love Potion #8, which is essentially a raspberry mocha (decadent and wonderful!). The second time, I got the avocado toast (not truly toast, as the bread is soft and untoasted, but I preferred it that way), which was fantastic, and a side of latkes, which were good but not as good as others I've had. Overall, it was a pleasant environment with nice good, wonderful coffee drinks, and relatively good service (a little slower than it should have been given the number of patrons the times I was there). The prices are a little on the high side for the amount of food you're getting, but are certainly reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Coffee bar
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Avocado thick cut toast

G9D_cJtyw9PHyCye2hMLTw.text: I came upon this place by mistake through NoWait. I'm happy I did. I just had a coffee and cinnamon roll, but both were excellent. Vegan baked goods can tend to be dry, but they seem to clearly understand maintaining moisture content in their baked goods. It's a beautifully redone building with a tasteful mixture or traditional tin ceilings and woodwork with modern lighting and finishes. The staff was very friendly and helpful.  I would recommend this place for vegans and their carnivorous friends ;-)

zHiGakcuxyRLrb5rOiLrpg.text: After waiting excitedly for this place to open, I stopped in for brunch. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable, and attentive with out being intrusive. I hear it can get busy, but the atmosphere is also welcoming to the lone bruncher or coffee sipper. I ordered the tofu scramble and toast with almond butter and raspberry jam. The food was fresh and very flavorful. Good portion sizes. Will be making this a regular brunch spot. Can't wait to try the lunch food (and hopefully dinner soon)!

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Toast with almond butter and raspberry jam
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tofu scramble

JRwEcXVuDh4qx2vZC9310A.text: It's been a while since my friend and I had lunch there so my memory is a bit blurry except to say that I'd go back there again real soon. I had the seitan shawarma half of which I took home 'cause it was pretty generous (I had some yummy lentil soup first). No room for dessert but they looked delish.

1UMne3Hc0V_REsqtUOezng.text: I have eaten at vegan restaurants on the West Coast and the East, and this place tops all of them... so much flavor tastefully done. I highly recommend the fries, the sauces, the sodas, and the flatbread. This place is new, so go there - We need to keep this place going in Pittsburgh.

NtBpOR8Yxb2KjlciJksW8Q.text: This place is fantastic. I went with a friend for lunch. Neither of us are vegan/veg but we wanted something lighter with this crazy hot weather and it looked like they would have a lot of different options. The waitress was really attentive and nice and was happy to help my friend with new dietary restrictions customize something that she could eat. I had the sauteed shiitakes and spinach along with the lentil soup of the day. The soup was phenomenal- high in flavor (not in saltiness) and really filling. My friend had the avocado salad which was a generous portion and with an amazing lemony dressing. The baba ganoush was fantastic- creamy and smoky (but not overly so). Everything was very high in flavor and visually appealing too. I will definitely be back to try all of the other things that looked great (cashew cheese flatbread, avocado toast, falafel, and many others). Also looks like a great take-out spot with a cafe window and tasty looking treats to go (hummus, baba, pickled vegetables, all sorts of desserts). Definitely great for vegans and non-vegans alike!

KZ5IMTiO6gch4oc1WB1ZHA.text: I love posting up at the bar with a pot of tea and lunch to get some work done. Great wifi, super friendly staff. Don't miss the brownies either.

y44O-LVpXZD7SpUwHhJZ0w.text: Absolutely amazing! I had the spicy kofta tofu sandwich and added shaved seitan, and holy moly was it worth every. single. penny. The avocado spread on the toast is perfect and has a hint of lemon. Awesome coffee, awesome atmosphere, great service, I can't say more. Next time I'm in Pittsburgh I will absolutely be eating here!

YUYxQlqR9ojGyv-iFee2fw.text: Unique takes on Mediterranean fare. Some of the dishes fail to match their non-vegan/vegetarian counterparts. The fresh house-made items are great quality and a blessing. Their chocolates are also unbelievable.

UeUvYde0mWLCchYZoesKoQ.text: Really awesome experience. Great vegan food, especially the falafel (yes, of course, it's vegan naturally) but so tasty and done right! Thanks, Omar, wishing you much success.

NmNu12NFgmr96Hq5zUvcIA.text: Defintely has  room to improve.  I came away with a 50/50 experience.  Loved the decor, the drop ceiling, the energy.  We had the Manakish and baba ghanoush.  The appetizer portions are too small for the price.  I loved the cashew cheese manakish but the shitake manakish lacked seasoning.  We asked for some flavor and got salt and pepper.

ouPkJeERRS6O2sh04oKuKA.text: Awesome flafel and humus! Labne is crushed cashew as they serve vegan diet so it's a totally different taste from Mediterranean/ m labne but it tastes good anyway. Cappuccino was not good at all!!

oeE7AXlok0vnSpuviTCfww.text: Amazing, fresh, beautifully made veg-friendly Mediterranean food! I'm so excited that a friend recommended we try this place instead of one of the local chains. She had been there for lunch, but not for dinner. So we went for appetizers and small plates. LOVED the apps...and the service! We'll be back!

lYKT3SCK_P6cKUeSYdhJ0A.text: Like to compliment B52 for doing excellent job catering last night for our Iftar..There was a variety of food with selective decisions which complimented each other..will purchase for personal consumption... Good Job Masha'allah

yr7J6ACAp5NUEC2KwkvuOQ.text: Got the Kofta tofu scramble and it was perfect. Also a "bottomless" coffee ($3 on weekends). This place exceeded my expectations. I arrived from out of town, flustered because I don't know the area, traffic was bad and parking difficult (you can parallel park on the street on Sundays, but its tight and just one lane in each direction so you piss off the people behind you). The cafe is adorable, clean and bright. There was a queue for tables but as I was dining on my own, I was seated at the gorgeous marble counter immediately.   They were really busy and I was probably not their ideal guest: party of one, and desperate to get online on my laptop (generally frowned upon in restaurants, especially trendy busy ones) for reasons I won't go into. Suffice it to say I was desperate enough to risk the eyerolls of busy staff..... but at B52 I didn't have to. Everyone was polite and efficient and helpful to a fault. I LOVED the food, it absolutely hit the spot. And I think I had three coffee refills before heading out.   I would definitely brave the traffic and parking to come again!

XKI4xEX0C7ZRHzM4XCuc5w.text: Falafel balls are the BOMB. Vanilla coffee also wonderful. Had the chocolate cake and was amazed.

GLTQLwquD7S8GAvqeQA6rQ.text: Not a vegan or vegetarian but I could eat here everyday. The cashew cheese is to die for and the sour dough pancakes are a must! I have only been for brunch, twice, but I hear there are doing dinner now! Looking forward to it!

knk6QehuFA57vDmBepk6lA.text: Love B52! I could eat here all the time! Me and my husband will just stop by to pick up some of their delicious baked goods! My favorite dish is the Kofta Tofu Scramble. I actually crave it! The roasted cauliflower is one of my favorite "appetizers". The menu isn't huge, but you will love everything you try. Their specialty drinks are super good too! Just typing this review makes me want to go there and eat. Most important detail..everything is vegan!

Ryg95srGVVvMoDubuWnA5A.text: First legitimate Middle Eastern/Vegetarian place in Pitt.  Take your pick off the menu - you wont go wrong!  Highly recommend the tea.

xv5ZfYZmBGZPcAJU7MH_EA.text: I'm not a vegan but if there were more restaurants like this I would be. Fantastic menu and the food was superb. Going back soon and often.

U3BuKiwN5BSC8DWs2dOF4Q.text: Popped in today for a quick breakfast to go. Cafe au lait with homemade almond milk was delicious. The milk was rich and creamy-yum! Also got a strawberry lemon muffin. It was still warm and there were nice big chunks of strawberry. It was excellent. Can't wait to try the rest of their menu. So far so good.

B0HSHrw2yevRpAOq1WgWpA.text: The portions we so nice and mezza platter perfect way to sample everything.  Nice atmosphere and really good vegan food.

ioxLaxSKsKIJKONfpHSswg.text: We finally got in to this place on a Saturday for lunch and I'm so glad we waited! My guy got the Seitan shwarma wrap and I got the cashew cheese wrap and minestrone soup. We were blown away by how fresh and delicious everything was. Great portions and even better prices. We will definitely be back soon! Great addition to the pittsburgh scene

DhVQufac3DQLcQTtEJ9Ypg.text: I love this place. The menu is creative and delicious. The space feels comfortable. And the service is patient and kind. One of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh.

TLf51wYkSShilxHFd_Z6mw.text: What happens when a carnivore walks in to a vegan cafe? Surprisingly, he gets full despite expectations! The 6-item mezze sampler is expensive, but fresh 'n filling. BYOB to increase the fun factor.

98yfRyKOTlYYqT8dMY5PUQ.text: The food and the place are exceptional but it is so very expensive. $36 (including tip) for breakfast for two on Sunday? My husband and son went yesterday and I was shocked at how much they paid. I do wish them success but I cannot afford to eat there!

97TCZNyadQxpvrPEq8vP6g.text: Don't even know what the hell I was eating but it was all fantastic am definitely going back

wUcj_yRX00ub9fCzrezTPg.text: Delicious food, inviting atmosphere, friendly service. High quality all round. I had a cashew cheese sandwich that was delicious. Baba is very good too. My son loved the chocolate chip cookie. Happy to have a legitimately good new veggie place in town.

JmcK8lo8Xbm8qTfodwcnIA.text: I died and went to vegan heaven. I had a latte, sandwich with cashew cheese and raspberry preserves. And we also split a cinnamon roll with a friend. It was all amazing! Can't wait to go back

-W5v8LX2gN9ZNOAkhvQq4g.text: Phenomenal brunch. Had the tofu scramble, avocado toast, and their iced green tea with agave. Unbelievable combo. Definitely ask for their hot sauce. Will undoubtedly be coming back as early as next weekend.

Evl82uc0RNWToeDw7KQc1g.text: Finally made my way to B52 for brunch today. We had the falafel, sourdough pancakes and tofu scramble. All were delicious and we even had leftovers to take. I also want to add that neither me or my boyfriend are vegan, but we both very much enjoyed the vegan middle eastern fare at B52. Definitely recommend!

qWZf7CGEB45a31lKkqhppg.text: This is one of my favorite vegan spots in the city.  I ordered the Sietan Schwarma sandwich with fries and it was amazing. Also, the baba Ghanoush is literally to die for! I will definitely be returning. It does get pretty busy in here but the take out is just as good!

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

BJiaJ-qaXklllzsVptKkBA.text: I am both vegan and gluten free and was so in love with the experience at B52! My girlfriend and I got the hummus with the GF bread and I would go back just for that, it was easily the best hummus and GF bread I've had.   We both got the Tofu Scramble and the Falafel Salad. The Falafel is definitely the best I have ever had. My girlfriend also had the peppermint hot chocolate and loved it. Everything was amazing.   The only thing is I wish the thad GF pancake option. We can't wait to go back!!

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Ne0DVgPu9rdzxvx76dxjng.text: B52 Cafe absolutely rocks. I have never had a bad, or even slightly negative, experience while dining at B52. This place is friendly, and yet, delicious. This is the place to take vegans and meat eaters alike. I have tried so many different foods and have always been happy.  For example, I don't even normally like pancakes, but after trying my friend's, I considered ordering pancakes. I've had cauliflower, hummus, flatbreads, chocolates, a cinnamon roll, "yogurt" parfait, and  have some of the best babaganoush I have ever had in my life. It is smoky, rich, and delicious.  All of the lattes and coffee drinks I've tried have been interesting and complex, but maybe a tiny bit too sweet for my taste.  I highly recommend B52 if you like fresh and flavorful food and great service.

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Avocado toast, mezze with falafel, cauliflower, and baba ghanouj. All delightful.

NWgBHv-eDJreP6wNmoRVzg.text: Wow. Original menu, delicious. Each meal a symphony. That may sound dramatic but it isn't.  Whether you're there for brunch, lunch or dinner you will be greeted by an inspired menu and friendly, no, the friendliest and most knowledgeable servers in Pittsburgh.  Enjoy the ambience, savor the food and the homemade Kombucha.  Go. Go now.

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

5VvbzpzwxBOOK1ENktsmhw.text: Trust me- you wouldn't even know this is a vegan restaurant if it wasn't advertised as such! My favorites are the avocado salad and anything baked. Can't wait to try to the pancakes next time!

hTPL903ypDyAV8FqM0n73A.text: I am giving B52 a 3 out of 5 for now with high hopes to change to a 4 upon further visits. We stumbled upon this place. It was cozy. They are a vegan bakery and cafe. They have many gluten free options as well. We ordered three apps and 1 small plate. The small plate (eggplant) was my favorite. The apps (hummus, cauliflower and falafel) were all good but nothing to write home about. I am looking forward to coming back and trying an entree or salad!

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Falafel, cauliflower and eggplant

cXfM6OaGYI024FmOjxuTnA.text: I came here for brunch for the first time this morning and had a great experience! They are a vegan restaurant that also offers gluten free options. I ordered the avocado toast, latkas and a vanilla latte... all were super yummy! They offer full service as well as options you can purchase to go at the counter. I went for the full service and the server was very friendly and knowledgeable. The only thing i would change is that for the latkas, typically they are served with apple sauce and they don't have it so i had ketchup instead. I'll definitely be back soon though to try the kombucha and tofu scramble that I've heard is incredible!

9EjjO4twGcw3-6i_YvblYQ.text: Super good food.  Took forever to finally get in, there's always a wait, which is a good sign I suppose.  But I was able to get in for my birthday! The pancakes were AMAZING!

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

l86DmUULAR6szEgCZc1O3w.text: I am so full of gratitude for this amazing place. Delicious food, great decor, great people and wonderful service.  I can't get enough!

CcwseZYxm0_1FluWllafQw.text: This place is delicious!!!   Came here on a Saturday morning around 11AM. We were immediately seated and served. My friend and I decided to share everything. We ordered avocado toast, a cashew cheese flatbread and blueberry sourdough buckwheat pancakes.   Our waitress was super attentive and the food came out so quickly. The avocado toast was perfect: crunchy toast, creamy avocado and lemony tahini sauce. We loved how fresh it tasted!   The cashew cheese flatbread was also delicious. The tomato sauce was very fresh and the olives gave a great salty bite. The cashew cheese was tangy and creamy. The flatbread was everything!  We ended our meal with the pancakes. They were sweet and delicious. A little difficult to cut into because of the buckwheat but still amazing. They were light and airy.   On our way out, I bought a cookie to go while my friend bought a cinnamon roll. Both were delicious! B52 is a great place!!

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Allegro Bakery Cakes (Carrot and Chocolate)
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cinnamon rolls
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate chip cookies

E9io03W-cWMVQIpVKAUsFg.text: The food here was just OK, had small portions and was a little overpriced in my opinion. Its a cute cafe though and probably a place you could do work if you went early in the day.   If you have money to spare and don't mind smaller portions, this is a cute, quaint place to go.

LT02WDSrifwaevCjZzG0xw.text: There were five in our party for dinner at B52 Cafe, a vegan restaurant located in Upper Lawrenceville. Only one of us was vegetarian, but all of us enjoyed the spectacular meal we had that night.  We started our meal with the Taste 6 mezze, which included hummus, fried cauliflower (YUM!), baba ghanouj, falafel (also YUM!), labneh, and tomatoes. The mezze also came with warm, pita bread.  Our small plates included fries with za'atar (MUST HAVE) and buffalo cauliflower (tasted better than it sounds). For my entree, I split the falafel sandwich with my wife. The sandwich was plenty for us to share.  Next time I'll save room for dessert. The bakalava looked fantastic.  Very attentive service. Food came out quickly. Would go back and our next visit to Pittsburgh.

4eDLC4CLcRnDqGU6Xaeglw.text: Wow!  Fantastic.  I just happened to stumble upon B52 while buying a plant at a nearby shop.  I am not vegan or even vegetarian.  The very helpful employee helped me with the menu.  I ordered the Kofta Tofu Scramble for breakfast.  It was incredible.  The atmosphere was welcoming.   I can't wait to go back!

uHmoqsyVmyG-Z3rLfJ4H6g.text: The food here is all vegan  which I loved. They definitely need more seating here especially on Sunday's for brunch. I waited maybe 15-20 minutes for my take out order at 1:45pm on Sunday which wasn't terrible. The people are really nice and patient. I couldn't make a quick decision since it was my first time there but I couldn't be happier with what I ordered. I had the Shiitake Mushroom flatbread which was so delicious. The crust had that perfect crunchiness and softness. I cannot wait to come back here again. I want to try the tofu scramble. I just wish I could reserve a table so I k is I won't have to wait too long.

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shiitake Mushroom Flatbread
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Falafel Salad
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Super busy on Sunday. Call in for pick up if you want take out.

G5wST73xvCTrx3i7prHTaQ.text: I am not vegan... but this place is, and it was a great experience. Came for breakfast and the almond milk cappuccino was on point. Very good avocado toast (hard to mess up but this was quite delicious) and some other nut butter/jammy toast which was very nice. Recommend the scrambles here for your main dish! I am still craving it and can't wait to go back next time I'm in Lawrenceville! Great service also!  Summary: Super excellent vegan breakfast food, easily infiltrated and enjoyed by meat eaters like myself.

JSaHUbdcq61OZ5dsOf5dJw.text: I went here today for such with wife and some friends. Its is a vegan style resteraunt. I started with a bowl of lentil soup which was delicious. I then had a house salad which was also very good. Then onto some potato latkes which where also very good. The place is a little on the small side so not a lot of customers can fit at one time but we managed. We where a party of 4 and where seated immediately and the server was very nice and very friendly. The food was overall very good and also fresh. I have to admit it generally is not the kind of food I would go for but I would recommend The b52 cafe if you are int h area.

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lentils soup

s__TyeLxLLKvQ_hEikcAuw.text: I lived in Pittsburgh for 4 months for work and frequented this place weekly. The almond butter toast with a home brewed kombucha was my go-to. Very cute location in Lawerenceville with hipster friendly staff. Open a location in SF!

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

dxmjvwc7HleFx_u3hShnPg.text: B52 is awesome! Seriously one of the best vegan meals I've ever had in my life! My dad and I stopped in on our XC road trip to California and were extremely satisfied with our meal. The Baba Ganoush is the best I've ever had in my entire life. No exaggeration. I have fever dreams about it. I would move to Pittsburgh just for that Baba.

h9HCu9mi0K5MkKIpqkZ59A.text: Love this place! Great food, great staff. Definitely a watering hole for us.  They have these big beautiful yummy pancakes that I usually go for when there for brunch or breakfast. With blueberries Bananas, real syrup, and their own homemade cashew butter, you truly can't go wrong. If you're not into fluffy stacks of carbs, then there's a couple versions of tofu scramble to choose from.  My other favorites on the menu are their lentil soups drizzled with pickled lemon, and their fried tomatoes. There's so much more to get into with sandwiches, salads, thick avocado or other types of toast, it's truly a great place for vegans and non-vegans alike!

CLXRzqiqgPmq5eFdWFk9ZQ.text: Grateful they exist. Some special foods... make their own milks and kombucha.  They use to carry amazing vegan Carmel chocolate but stopped making them.   The tofu scramble I had twice and was very oily both times. The y'all server w neared is surprisingly curt and seems pretty inconvenienced by customers. Been many times and never felt welcomed by him. Maybe he is friends w owner?   Some basics are great like their avocado toast and lentils soup. The pickled cabbage side is amazing! Very cute space... hope they warm energy little w some staff and bring back chocolates.

ZCI_3bQ61De4A1u6z2Nzeg.text: Had an amazing lunch with a friend today at B52! We each had the specialty latte, which was extremely creamy and delicious with notes of orange, vanilla and cinnamon. For our appetizer, we choose a trio of dips(hummus, cashew cheese dip and eggplant dip). While we loved them all, our favorite was definitely the eggplant dip, which had a delicious smokey flavor. The dips came with a side of the best and freshest pita bread we have ever had! As our main meals, she got the cashew cheese flatbread and I got the kofta. Both were sooo fresh and full of flavor! We ended our meals with a cinnamon bun (because we couldn't help ourselves), and oh my goodness it tasted like paradise on earth. Wow, I really cannot say enough about how lovely B52 is. Truly an amazing addition to the Pittsburgh vegan restaurant scene!

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kofta
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vanilla orange cinnamon latte
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Trio of dips (eggplant dip, cashew cheese dip, and hummus)

ZBD6I8l1sal8megGMbMw3A.text: Delicious food whether you're strictly veggies or used to eating meat, you won't be disappointed!

PzSREApqpvArLpW2kTs2tA.text: Fresh perfect food, coffee, dessert and great space and staff are wonderful   You must go, try the falafel sandwich omg so good!

Afyiz1CmGSeT8FLI2pDvWA.text: For a person respecting all living animals this place is the place to dine. FULL VEGAN menu with an assortment of options both classic vegan and Mediterranean. Service is on point and food is quick and tastes phenomenal. This is THE go to Vegan option in PGH. Keep it up B52!

8vdf0xSAAVFkCB32NaZxog.text: Very pleasantly surprised by the quality of all the ingredients. The falafel was so well made and I have frequented many NY and LA falafel joints. I couldn't believe there wasn't any cream in my Matcha tea until they explained that they make their own almond milk! It was so rich and guilt free!! We will definitely return to try more!

eElmjJwzX1wGljdTSb2WuA.text: I tried B52 tonight for the first time and think I'm in love. I will be dreaming of their baba ganoush. Hands down the best I've ever had. I got a falafel wrap and my partner got the kabob, and both were really delicious. Can't wait to go back!

TXlM3mPlWtJyTAEkWzvrFQ.text: This food is amazing. I eat lunch from b52 frequently and the vegan sataien wrappy is the best vegetarian wrap ive ever had! The food is absolutely delicious and extreamly healthy. The serving portions and very filling and the cost is reasonable. I would highly recommend this restaurant as one of my favorite vegetarian plugs in the Burgh!

pXkPjeDKwcCuFy5mWdgxRg.text: While visiting our daughter for the Christmas holiday we had lunch at B52.  It was our last day and we had several options.  Choosing B52 was easy.  The day before we dropped in for coffee/lattes to go.  They were excellent.  For lunch we had avocado toast, latke, shawarma, roasted cauliflower and coffee drinks again.  Everything was delicious. Generous in portions. The wait team was attentive, happy and helpful.  Omar, the owner, stopped by and shared a story or 2.  When we go back to Lawrenceville next spring we will be back!

78Jftkr2U5i1Fn3Emr45Qg.text: LOVE THIS PLACE  The kofta tofu scramble, cashew cheese manakish, moussaka entree and chocolate chip cookies are my favorites so far.  I plan on trying a lot more dishes and their Sunday brunch specials when I get a chance.  Everything is flavored just right, not too much or too little and nothing is over or under salted which is the case at so many restaurants even the high-end ones.  I don't know about others but the entrees leave me feeling full for at least 6-7 hours.  Bottom line, even if you are not vegan, you will find more than one thing to enjoy here.

FMUP1m0apQH4t-SJjapSyA.text: Came here for lunch last week with a group of friends.  Started with a heaping order of avocado and peanut butter toast.  Both were excellent, especially the avocado. We also had the latkes which were good but not great.  I also ordered a 3 mezze sampler.  The hummus was fresh but the babaganoush was lacking for sure (I barely had more than a few bites).  We also had the falafel sandwich (which was pretty good but again not amazing, I don't think they make their pita fresh) and the cashew cheese sandwich.  The cashew cheese was pretty gross but that's not their fault as it's never very good (may taste ok going down but your stomach will be bloated and hurting for hours after).  If you are craving interesting vegan food in Pittsburgh, I would recommend going to Apteka and skipping this place.

gZQ1HykYg58zUrhw3H_gCQ.text: After a few visits, I have enjoyed all they have offered. The kombucha, tea, and dinner was delicious. Their hummus is great!

PB3arYu8oO3ZpmMP9LU8vQ.text: When I first walked into B52, I noticed the drop ceiling with reclaimed tin ceiling tiles and open brick walls. The layout and color palette was relaxing and quaint. The 32 seat cafe includes a full service coffee and espresso bar, as well as, small bakery and take out section. While waiting for a table, my mouth watered over the fresh baked goods including vegan cinnamon rolls, brownies, truffles, cookies, and more! The menu has a Mediterranean theme, but it also includes some general vegan staples such as tofu scramble and buckwheat pancakes. The best part about the menu is that everything is made in house and prepared fresh! The kofta tofu scramble is a MUST try for brunch! Don't hesitate to head to B52 for your next vegan meal! Check out my full review at veganhostess.com/2016/01...

MC6A-ZO2eHJiN_f-WYvUvw.text: It was so good I came back for more. I stayed in Pittsburgh for the weekend and this little place was down the block. Had dinner and breakfast the next morning here. Baba ganoush was the best I've had and their homemade seitan was great. They had so much great stuff on the menu. Defiantly a destination spot for vegans/vegetarians or just people looking for great food.

MZ74H3QyXz9TV8pouzh71g.text: We were visiting Pittsburgh recently, and of course tried as many vegan or vegan-friendly places as possible. B52 stood out. We went for a weekday breakfast, so those were the only foods we tried. Our waitress was super friendly and attentive, and helped us choose amongst the multiple tempting choices on the menu. I got the spicy kofta tofu scramble, which was truly amazing. I've had a lot of scrambles, but this one was especially good. We tried the cashew cheese mannish (flatbread) too, and that was great. And don't miss the baked goods - the brownie was fair, but the chocolate chip cookies were divine, and vegan cinnamon rolls? I can be pretty picky about those, but these were perfect. So glad to have found this place!!

xYs9uOuIkRHuQ1rrAIgURA.text: I sought this place out for a unique breakfast experience in Lawrenceville neighborhood and arrived just after 9am. It was not crowded, and the service was very fast. I ordered a latte that came with almond milk (it's vegan after all) but the after taste was so bad my stomach turned every time I took a sip. I've never had an almond milk latte before so I have no idea if this is normal tasting. My husband loved his straight up black coffee, so I think if you don't get fancy it's all good.  I had toast with cashew butter and raspberry jam which was delicious, and potato / carrot latkes. They were fine.  Husband had a tofu seitan scramble with kale, which was also basic and fine. We were on vacation so had no access to a kitchen--it would have been a very easy thing to make quickly at home too.   The experience was capped off by the couple next to us discussing in horror that we get our coconut products from slave monkeys that are beaten and abused if they do not harvest enough coconuts.

BNTvYiRaGJnwbggQgYrobw.text: As it seems that the trend for more vegetarian and vegan cafes seems to be picking up, B52 is a cute little addition to Lawrenceville.  I met friends for brunch, and luckily we went early (10am) because by 11:00 the seating was all filled up.  After a morning run, I chose the hearty kofta-tofu scramble, and was not disappointed. I am not vegan, nor a vegetarian, but the flavors of this dish were just as good as many eggs and sausage dishes I've tried.  The most noticeable thing about the dish was the size...it was easily a double portion, and I took home the other half...which made my Monday morning quite nice ;)  My friends ordered the granola parfait and the pancake, and my meal was definitely the biggest portion. The granola parfait was noticeably small, but went great when paired with another food item.  Unfortunately, the sweet side of my meal wasn't quite as good as the savory.  My friend and I both ordered cinnamon rolls, which looked amazing presented in the glass serving dish on the counter.  Our waitress brought them to us warm, and with the icing melted on top we were really excited for a brunch splurge.  So it was a little disappointing when all I could think about was how I needed a glass of milk to wash it down...or better yet, dunk it!  The pastry was so dry, and I kept thinking...maybe it just needs...some eggs?  Milk?  Not sure, but it just wasn't what I was hoping it would be.  The cinnamon swirl was flavorful and would have been delicious if I was eating a scone...but a cinnamon roll is supposed to be soft, gew-y and doughy...and this one was not.  So my take-home message is this....if you like the hipster vibe of Lawrenceville, B52 Cafe will feel right at home.  Get the scramble, skip the cinnamon roll.

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kofta-tofu scramble.  Great portion and flavor

IBzw0xo1UWy47KFd0XEvNQ.text: An excellent Chef with a very creative menu. Everything on the menu is super tasty but I particularly love the fried tomatoes and the kabob dish. And the cashew cheese is amazing!  I always buy a pack of that to go.  Definitely one of my most favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh.

m89IpMmmR-DwoNiNl1e37g.text: Always a fantastic meal at B52 - breakfast, lunch or dinner.  The labneh is worth a visit all on its own.

ScbtH8NWmn_OPbw09zqtTw.text: Came here on a date night and was not disappointed. We split the six-plate mezze and every dish was delicious (though the fried tomatoes definitely stole the spotlight). It was the perfect amount of food for two and service was great throughout. Definitely recommend.

RTZY-tSHaMERRCngPAEmvg.text: The dining experience and service is pathetic. After we were seated for 15 minutes nobody came to check on us. I had to stand up and go after some server and ask for menu, water, etc. Then he said "sorry".  After that we tried the cashew cheese appetizer, my husband and I both liked it. For main course, I had the onion flat bread and he had the falafel sandwich. The onion flatbread was too sweet ( I am not sure if they added sugar or not). I was expecting more of a savory taste, also because on the menu it indicated that it has sumac (one of my favorite spices) which has a savory/sour taste. I did not like the onion flatbread. My husband said the falafel sandwich was not very well balanced: some parts had too little veggies to balance out the falafel.   I would have liked to return to try out other items on the menu, but with their pathetic service, I doubt it.

QwrGmGijd6X5yEAwAynAZw.text: This place was so cute and delicious! Parking is along the main or side streets. They accept cash and cards. They do not however accept reservations but they do start a waitlist if they get busy.  We came because a good friend is vegan for health reasons. I started with an iced coffee and almond milk. When the milk separates it weirds me out but it still tastes good. I got a side of the amazing garlicky sauteed shiitakes and kale. I ordered the avocado sandwich that was made with shiitake bacon and on homemade bread. I got a side of fresh cut fries because DUH that I opted to add the wonderful spice blend of za'atar (do it and you'll thank me). Much to my delight I got a surprise side of harissa ketchup which was life changing! So much so I bought some of their homemade harissa and was told to just add whatever ketchup I liked to it.   Can't wait to come again!

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sautéed Shiitake
Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Avocado sandwich with shiitake bacon

k3GpBmpktoNFEPwHI7yTcA.text: My boyfriend had been telling me he wanted to take me here, and I had heard rave reviews from friends, so we went yesterday (a Sunday) for a nice little date. As I'm sure you know, Sundays are busy at establishments that offer brunch, so there was a wait, but it wasn't terrible. Kudos to the staff, because even though they were slammed, people who were coming in just a half hour til close we're still welcomed and given time to consider the menu options.  We started with Lavender Vanilla Lattes, which were pretty much perfect: Not too sweet, but not bland. If anything, I'd have liked to have tasted the lavender more. My guy was a little bummed that the Brunch Menu didn't include any sandwiches (which he enjoys a lot off of the weekday menu) but he opted for thick cut Avocado Toast, which we both LOVED.  I got the Tofu Scramble. The tofu was the perfect, fluffy consistency and could pass for eggs. The side of Kale and Shitakes was fabulous, and as someone who is leery of kale (because it is SO easy to cook badly!) I was impressed. The accompanying latkes were a bit lackluster, but maybe that's my Jewish background making me extremely critical of the dish.  I topped everything with a hearty portion of Zhoug, which I personally believe could save most food. Caution: If you're not a Spice Fan, steer clear of the Zhoug! The Cashew Cheese was a let-down, but mostly because of personal preference. It had a bit too much tang, and I'm normally fine with that, but I prefer a more nutty/ umami cashew cheese.  I honestly would recommend this place though, gripes aside, because of the efficient service and cozy atmosphere. Give it a try, even if you're not Vegan!

BkZEKC74LJwBu0IDXeLQsg.text: My husband and I always stop in here for coffee before our fresh cuts at 10th Ward Barber. We ate brunch a looooong time ago so I can't recall any of that. But...  Pros *Delicious iced Americanos *no straws! They have these cool recyclable plastic cups with a little drinking spout on top #yayyenvironment *Cool bar seating and see-and-be-seen window seating *Hip and friendly staff - hipper than us anyway  Cons *The gigantic vegan chocolate cake stares at us while we're waiting for our coffees. Just rude. *Line can go out the door during really busy times so be prepared *Lawrenceville parking

B_by1815E7H2ZWirS_lBMA.text: Comin' in hot with another rave review!! My friend and I went wild and out for dinner and ordered a bunch of things off the menu, and we'd love to come back and try the others/brunch. Neither of us are vegetarians, either! The highlights:  - The seitan kabobs were wild! I'm usually a little reluctant to order seitan because it can be soooo dry, but these are honkin' chunks are so thoroughly marinated all the way through and m o i s t. I've never had seitan like this before! I didn't even know it could come in such big honks! Honestly amazing. You can build a perfect seitany bite with the hummus, 'yogurt' dip, and brown rice it comes with. - The fried oyster mushrooms (as an appetizer) were delicious! They reminded me of fried oysters. (It never occurred to me that this is why the mushrooms are named what they are.)  We also did the Mezze 3 with hummus, the baba ghanoush, and the falafel. All quality. My friend got their house brewed kombucha and I wish it was a little bubblier, but I can't get my own kombucha to hold carbonation to save anyone's life so I commiserate.

photos.caption: Photo of B52 Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seitan kabobs - out of this dang world!!

-9wtrPOxQl-IxqoxxGAy4A.text: Very good first experience! Had the: Baba Ghanouj (smoke) Eggplant Pesto (Must Try!) Spinach Pie Kabob Salad Combucha to Drink (Lemon Ginger) Really good service by Thaddeus! Very reasonable priced. Felt our cholesterol drop as we enjoyed very good food with good flavor!
